Facebook Shifts Resources from News to Focus on Creator Economy

stories.text:
Say you have a podcast and you want your listeners to send you voice messages.

The only available options are:

- listeners call you via phone (costs them money, very high prices for international listeners); - or, users record themselves on an app, attach the file to an email and send you the file (very cumbersome, high risk of failure due to file size, format, ...).

I didn't like these "solutions": they both introduce a very high frictional process to listeners and, for me, are a huge PIA to manage.

To fix this whole situation, I built https://mono.tn (read: monotone). It's a simple tool to allow listeners, wherever they are, to easily send me voice messages.

Now, it only takes three taps (or clicks) on their phone (or computer) to complete the whole process. And I have a single place to manage all the messages I receive.

I'm curious to know if people other than me would find this tool useful?
stories.title: Show HN: I built a tool for my podcast listeners to send me voice messages
